1.text: Now about the times and seasons, brothers, we do not need to write to you.

2.text: For you are fully aware that the Day of the Lord will come like a thief in the night.

3.text: While people are saying, “Peace and security,” destruction will come upon them suddenly, like labor pains on a pregnant woman, and they will not escape.

4.text: But you, brothers, are not in the darkness so that this day should overtake you like a thief.

5.text: For you are all sons of the light and sons of the day; we do not belong to the night or to the darkness.

6.text: So then, let us not sleep as the others do, but let us remain awake and sober.

7.text: For those who sleep, sleep at night, and those who get drunk, get drunk at night.

8.text: But since we belong to the day, let us be sober, putting on the breastplate of faith and love, and the helmet of our hope of salvation.

9.text: For God has not appointed us to suffer wrath, but to obtain salvation through our Lord Jesus Christ.

10.text: He died for us so that, whether we are awake or asleep, we may live together with Him.

11.text: Therefore encourage and build one another up, just as you are already doing.

12.text: But we ask you, brothers, to acknowledge those who work diligently among you, who care for you in the Lord and who admonish you.

13.text: In love, hold them in highest regard because of their work. Live in peace with one another.

14.text: And we urge you, brothers, to admonish the unruly, encourage the fainthearted, help the weak, and be patient with everyone.

15.text: Make sure that no one repays evil for evil. Always pursue what is good for one another and for all people.

18.text: Give thanks in every circumstance, for this is God’s will for you in Christ Jesus.

20.text: Do not treat prophecies with contempt,

21.text: but test all things. Hold fast to what is good.

22.text: Abstain from every form of evil.

23.text: Now may the God of peace Himself sanctify you completely, and may your entire spirit, soul, and body be kept blameless at the coming of our Lord Jesus Christ.

24.text: The One who calls you is faithful, and He will do it.

25.text: Brothers, pray for us as well.

26.text: Greet all the brothers with a holy kiss.

27.text: I charge you before the Lord to have this letter read to all the brothers.

28.text: The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you.
